body_html:
@samikama Yeah, It really due to the lack of GPU memory. When I only select one precision mode at once to run, everything works fine.

#!/bin/bash
python tftrt_sample.py --INT8 \
                       --num_loops 10 \
                       --topN 5 \
                       --batch_size 1 \
                       --workspace_size 3000 \
                       --log_file log.txt \
                       --network resnet_v1_50_frozen.pb \
                       --input_node input \
                       --output_nodes resnet_v1_50/predictions/Reshape_1 \
                       --img_size 224 \
                       --img_file  grace_hopper.jpg

Thanks!

Now, I can ensure that TensorRT 3.0.4 for Ubuntu 14.04 works fine on Ubuntu 18.04 with TensorFlow 1.8.0!
When TensorRT 4 RC can get the same result?

body:
@samikama Yeah, It really due to the lack of GPU memory. When I only select one precision mode at once to run, everything works fine.
```
#!/bin/bash
python tftrt_sample.py --INT8 \
                       --num_loops 10 \
                       --topN 5 \
                       --batch_size 1 \
                       --workspace_size 3000 \
                       --log_file log.txt \
                       --network resnet_v1_50_frozen.pb \
                       --input_node input \
                       --output_nodes resnet_v1_50/predictions/Reshape_1 \
                       --img_size 224 \
                       --img_file  grace_hopper.jpg
```
Thanks!

**Now, I can ensure that TensorRT 3.0.4 for Ubuntu 14.04 works fine on Ubuntu 18.04 with TensorFlow 1.8.0!**
When TensorRT 4 RC can get the same result?
